30#include <sys/cdefs.h>
31__KERNEL_RCSID(0, "$NetBSD: intel_fifo_underrun.c,v 1.2 2018/08/27 04:58:24 riastradh Exp $");
32
33#include "i915_drv.h"
34#include "intel_drv.h"
35
36/**
37 * DOC: fifo underrun handling
38 *
39 * The i915 driver checks for display fifo underruns using the interrupt signals
40 * provided by the hardware. This is enabled by default and fairly useful to
41 * debug display issues, especially watermark settings.
42 *
43 * If an underrun is detected this is logged into dmesg. To avoid flooding logs
44 * and occupying the cpu underrun interrupts are disabled after the first
45 * occurrence until the next modeset on a given pipe.
46 *
47 * Note that underrun detection on gmch platforms is a bit more ugly since there
48 * is no interrupt (despite that the signalling bit is in the PIPESTAT pipe
49 * interrupt register). Also on some other platforms underrun interrupts are
50 * shared, which means that if we detect an underrun we need to disable underrun
51 * reporting on all pipes.
52 *
53 * The code also supports underrun detection on the PCH transcoder.
54 */
55
56static bool ivb_can_enable_err_int(struct drm_device *dev)
57{
58 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
59 struct intel_crtc *crtc;
60 enum i915_pipe pipe;
61
62 assert_spin_locked(&dev_priv->irq_lock);
63
64 for_each_pipe(dev_priv, pipe) {
65 crtc = to_intel_crtc(dev_priv->pipe_to_crtc_mapping[pipe]);
66
67 if (crtc->cpu_fifo_underrun_disabled)
68 return false;
69 }
70
71 return true;
72}
73
74static bool cpt_can_enable_serr_int(struct drm_device *dev)
75{
76 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
77 enum i915_pipe pipe;
78 struct intel_crtc *crtc;
79
80 assert_spin_locked(&dev_priv->irq_lock);
81
82 for_each_pipe(dev_priv, pipe) {
83 crtc = to_intel_crtc(dev_priv->pipe_to_crtc_mapping[pipe]);
84
85 if (crtc->pch_fifo_underrun_disabled)
86 return false;
87 }
88
89 return true;
90}
91
92/**
93 * i9xx_check_fifo_underruns - check for fifo underruns
94 * @dev_priv: i915 device instance
95 *
96 * This function checks for fifo underruns on GMCH platforms. This needs to be
97 * done manually on modeset to make sure that we catch all underruns since they
98 * do not generate an interrupt by themselves on these platforms.
99 */
100void i9xx_check_fifo_underruns(struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv)
101{
102 struct intel_crtc *crtc;
103
104 spin_lock_irq(&dev_priv->irq_lock);
105
106 for_each_intel_crtc(dev_priv->dev, crtc) {
107 u32 reg = PIPESTAT(crtc->pipe);
108 u32 pipestat;
109
110 if (crtc->cpu_fifo_underrun_disabled)
111 continue;
112
113 pipestat = I915_READ(reg) & 0xffff0000;
114 if ((pipestat & PIPE_FIFO_UNDERRUN_STATUS) == 0)
115 continue;
116
117 I915_WRITE(reg, pipestat | PIPE_FIFO_UNDERRUN_STATUS);
118 POSTING_READ(reg);
119
120 DRM_ERROR("pipe %c underrun\n", pipe_name(crtc->pipe));
121 }
122
123 spin_unlock_irq(&dev_priv->irq_lock);
124}
125
126static void i9xx_set_fifo_underrun_reporting(struct drm_device *dev,
127 enum i915_pipe pipe,
128 bool enable, bool old)
129{
130 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
131 u32 reg = PIPESTAT(pipe);
132 u32 pipestat = I915_READ(reg) & 0xffff0000;
133
134 assert_spin_locked(&dev_priv->irq_lock);
135
136 if (enable) {
137 I915_WRITE(reg, pipestat | PIPE_FIFO_UNDERRUN_STATUS);
138 POSTING_READ(reg);
139 } else {
140 if (old && pipestat & PIPE_FIFO_UNDERRUN_STATUS)
141 DRM_ERROR("pipe %c underrun\n", pipe_name(pipe));
142 }
143}
144
145static void ironlake_set_fifo_underrun_reporting(struct drm_device *dev,
146 enum i915_pipe pipe, bool enable)
147{
148 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
149 uint32_t bit = (pipe == PIPE_A) ? DE_PIPEA_FIFO_UNDERRUN :
150 DE_PIPEB_FIFO_UNDERRUN;
151
152 if (enable)
153 ironlake_enable_display_irq(dev_priv, bit);
154 else
155 ironlake_disable_display_irq(dev_priv, bit);
156}
157
158static void ivybridge_set_fifo_underrun_reporting(struct drm_device *dev,
159 enum i915_pipe pipe,
160 bool enable, bool old)
161{
162 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
163 if (enable) {
164 I915_WRITE(GEN7_ERR_INT, ERR_INT_FIFO_UNDERRUN(pipe));
165
166 if (!ivb_can_enable_err_int(dev))
167 return;
168
169 ironlake_enable_display_irq(dev_priv, DE_ERR_INT_IVB);
170 } else {
171 ironlake_disable_display_irq(dev_priv, DE_ERR_INT_IVB);
172
173 if (old &&
174 I915_READ(GEN7_ERR_INT) & ERR_INT_FIFO_UNDERRUN(pipe)) {
175 DRM_ERROR("uncleared fifo underrun on pipe %c\n",
176 pipe_name(pipe));
177 }
178 }
179}
180
181static void broadwell_set_fifo_underrun_reporting(struct drm_device *dev,
182 enum i915_pipe pipe, bool enable)
183{
184 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
185
186 assert_spin_locked(&dev_priv->irq_lock);
187
188 if (enable)
189 dev_priv->de_irq_mask[pipe] &= ~GEN8_PIPE_FIFO_UNDERRUN;
190 else
191 dev_priv->de_irq_mask[pipe] |= GEN8_PIPE_FIFO_UNDERRUN;
192 I915_WRITE(GEN8_DE_PIPE_IMR(pipe), dev_priv->de_irq_mask[pipe]);
193 POSTING_READ(GEN8_DE_PIPE_IMR(pipe));
194}
195
196static void ibx_set_fifo_underrun_reporting(struct drm_device *dev,
197 enum transcoder pch_transcoder,
198 bool enable)
199{
200 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
201 uint32_t bit = (pch_transcoder == TRANSCODER_A) ?
202 SDE_TRANSA_FIFO_UNDER : SDE_TRANSB_FIFO_UNDER;
203
204 if (enable)
205 ibx_enable_display_interrupt(dev_priv, bit);
206 else
207 ibx_disable_display_interrupt(dev_priv, bit);
208}
209
210static void cpt_set_fifo_underrun_reporting(struct drm_device *dev,
211 enum transcoder pch_transcoder,
212 bool enable, bool old)
213{
214 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
215
216 if (enable) {
217 I915_WRITE(SERR_INT,
218 SERR_INT_TRANS_FIFO_UNDERRUN(pch_transcoder));
219
220 if (!cpt_can_enable_serr_int(dev))
221 return;
222
223 ibx_enable_display_interrupt(dev_priv, SDE_ERROR_CPT);
224 } else {
225 ibx_disable_display_interrupt(dev_priv, SDE_ERROR_CPT);
226
227 if (old && I915_READ(SERR_INT) &
228 SERR_INT_TRANS_FIFO_UNDERRUN(pch_transcoder)) {
229 DRM_ERROR("uncleared pch fifo underrun on pch transcoder %c\n",
230 transcoder_name(pch_transcoder));
231 }
232 }
233}
234
235static bool __intel_set_cpu_fifo_underrun_reporting(struct drm_device *dev,
236 enum i915_pipe pipe, bool enable)
237{
238 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
239 struct drm_crtc *crtc = dev_priv->pipe_to_crtc_mapping[pipe];
240 struct intel_crtc *intel_crtc = to_intel_crtc(crtc);
241 bool old;
242
243 assert_spin_locked(&dev_priv->irq_lock);
244
245 old = !intel_crtc->cpu_fifo_underrun_disabled;
246 intel_crtc->cpu_fifo_underrun_disabled = !enable;
247
248 if (HAS_GMCH_DISPLAY(dev))
249 i9xx_set_fifo_underrun_reporting(dev, pipe, enable, old);
250 else if (IS_GEN5(dev) || IS_GEN6(dev))
251 ironlake_set_fifo_underrun_reporting(dev, pipe, enable);
252 else if (IS_GEN7(dev))
253 ivybridge_set_fifo_underrun_reporting(dev, pipe, enable, old);
254 else if (IS_GEN8(dev) || IS_GEN9(dev))
255 broadwell_set_fifo_underrun_reporting(dev, pipe, enable);
256
257 return old;
258}
259
260/**
261 * intel_set_cpu_fifo_underrun_reporting - set cpu fifo underrrun reporting state
262 * @dev_priv: i915 device instance
263 * @pipe: (CPU) pipe to set state for
264 * @enable: whether underruns should be reported or not
265 *
266 * This function sets the fifo underrun state for @pipe. It is used in the
267 * modeset code to avoid false positives since on many platforms underruns are
268 * expected when disabling or enabling the pipe.
269 *
270 * Notice that on some platforms disabling underrun reports for one pipe
271 * disables for all due to shared interrupts. Actual reporting is still per-pipe
272 * though.
273 *
274 * Returns the previous state of underrun reporting.
275 */
276bool intel_set_cpu_fifo_underrun_reporting(struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv,
277 enum i915_pipe pipe, bool enable)
278{
279 unsigned long flags;
280 bool ret;
281
282 spin_lock_irqsave(&dev_priv->irq_lock, flags);
283 ret = __intel_set_cpu_fifo_underrun_reporting(dev_priv->dev, pipe,
284 enable);
285 spin_unlock_irqrestore(&dev_priv->irq_lock, flags);
286
287 return ret;
288}
289
290/**
291 * intel_set_pch_fifo_underrun_reporting - set PCH fifo underrun reporting state
292 * @dev_priv: i915 device instance
293 * @pch_transcoder: the PCH transcoder (same as pipe on IVB and older)
294 * @enable: whether underruns should be reported or not
295 *
296 * This function makes us disable or enable PCH fifo underruns for a specific
297 * PCH transcoder. Notice that on some PCHs (e.g. CPT/PPT), disabling FIFO
298 * underrun reporting for one transcoder may also disable all the other PCH
299 * error interruts for the other transcoders, due to the fact that there's just
300 * one interrupt mask/enable bit for all the transcoders.
301 *
302 * Returns the previous state of underrun reporting.
303 */
304bool intel_set_pch_fifo_underrun_reporting(struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv,
305 enum transcoder pch_transcoder,
306 bool enable)
307{
308 struct drm_crtc *crtc = dev_priv->pipe_to_crtc_mapping[pch_transcoder];
309 struct intel_crtc *intel_crtc = to_intel_crtc(crtc);
310 unsigned long flags;
311 bool old;
312
313 /*
314 * NOTE: Pre-LPT has a fixed cpu pipe -> pch transcoder mapping, but LPT
315 * has only one pch transcoder A that all pipes can use. To avoid racy
316 * pch transcoder -> pipe lookups from interrupt code simply store the
317 * underrun statistics in crtc A. Since we never expose this anywhere
318 * nor use it outside of the fifo underrun code here using the "wrong"
319 * crtc on LPT won't cause issues.
320 */
321
322 spin_lock_irqsave(&dev_priv->irq_lock, flags);
323
324 old = !intel_crtc->pch_fifo_underrun_disabled;
325 intel_crtc->pch_fifo_underrun_disabled = !enable;
326
327 if (HAS_PCH_IBX(dev_priv->dev))
328 ibx_set_fifo_underrun_reporting(dev_priv->dev, pch_transcoder,
329 enable);
330 else
331 cpt_set_fifo_underrun_reporting(dev_priv->dev, pch_transcoder,
332 enable, old);
333
334 spin_unlock_irqrestore(&dev_priv->irq_lock, flags);
335 return old;
336}
337
338/**
339 * intel_cpu_fifo_underrun_irq_handler - handle CPU fifo underrun interrupt
340 * @dev_priv: i915 device instance
341 * @pipe: (CPU) pipe to set state for
342 *
343 * This handles a CPU fifo underrun interrupt, generating an underrun warning
344 * into dmesg if underrun reporting is enabled and then disables the underrun
345 * interrupt to avoid an irq storm.
346 */
347void intel_cpu_fifo_underrun_irq_handler(struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv,
348 enum i915_pipe pipe)
349{
350 struct drm_crtc *crtc = dev_priv->pipe_to_crtc_mapping[pipe];
351
352 /* We may be called too early in init, thanks BIOS! */
353 if (crtc == NULL)
354 return;
355
356 /* GMCH can't disable fifo underruns, filter them. */
357 if (HAS_GMCH_DISPLAY(dev_priv->dev) &&
358 to_intel_crtc(crtc)->cpu_fifo_underrun_disabled)
359 return;
360
361 if (intel_set_cpu_fifo_underrun_reporting(dev_priv, pipe, false))
362 DRM_ERROR("CPU pipe %c FIFO underrun\n",
363 pipe_name(pipe));
364}
365
366/**
367 * intel_pch_fifo_underrun_irq_handler - handle PCH fifo underrun interrupt
368 * @dev_priv: i915 device instance
369 * @pch_transcoder: the PCH transcoder (same as pipe on IVB and older)
370 *
371 * This handles a PCH fifo underrun interrupt, generating an underrun warning
372 * into dmesg if underrun reporting is enabled and then disables the underrun
373 * interrupt to avoid an irq storm.
374 */
375void intel_pch_fifo_underrun_irq_handler(struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv,
376 enum transcoder pch_transcoder)
377{
378 if (intel_set_pch_fifo_underrun_reporting(dev_priv, pch_transcoder,
379 false))
380 DRM_ERROR("PCH transcoder %c FIFO underrun\n",
381 transcoder_name(pch_transcoder));
382}
